Package org.radarbase.management.web.rest

Class AccountResource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.radarbase.management.web.rest.AccountResource
  • @RestController
@RequestMapping("/api")
public class AccountResource
extends java.lang.Object
    REST controller for managing the current user's account.

    • Method Detail

      • activateAccount

        @GetMapping("/activate")
@Timed
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> activateAccount​(@RequestParam("key")
                                                                                 java.lang.String key)
        GET /activate : activate the registered user.
        Parameters:
        key - the activation key
        Returns:
        the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) and the activated user in body, or status 500 (Internal Server Error) if the user couldn't be activated

      • authenticate

        @GetMapping("/authenticate")
@Timed
public java.lang.String authenticate​(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
        GET /authenticate : check if the user is authenticated, and return its login.
        Parameters:
        request - the HTTP request
        Returns:
        the login if the user is authenticated

      • getAccount

        @GetMapping("/account")
@Timed
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<UserDTO> getAccount()
        GET /account : get the current user.
        Returns:
        the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) and the current user in body, or status 500 (Internal Server Error) if the user couldn't be returned

      • saveAccount

        @PostMapping("/account")
@Timed
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.Void> saveAccount​(@Valid @RequestBody
                                                                           @Valid UserDTO userDto)
        POST /account : update the current user information.
        Parameters:
        userDto - the current user information
        Returns:
        the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK), or status 400 (Bad Request) or 500 (Internal Server Error) if the user couldn't be updated

      • changePassword

        @PostMapping(path="/account/change_password",
             produces="text/plain")
@Timed
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> changePassword​(@RequestBody
                                                                                java.lang.String password)
        POST /account/change_password : changes the current user's password.
        Parameters:
        password - the new password
        Returns:
        the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK), or status 400 (Bad Request) if the new password is not strong enough

      • requestActivationReset

        @PostMapping(path="/account/reset-activation/init",
             produces="text/plain")
@Timed
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> requestActivationReset​(@RequestBody
                                                                                        java.lang.String login)
        POST /account/reset-activation/init : Send an email to resend the password activation for the the user.
        Parameters:
        login - the login of the user
        Returns:
        the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) if the email was sent, or status 400 (Bad Request) if the email address is not registered or user is not deactivated

      • requestPasswordReset

        @PostMapping(path="/account/reset_password/init",
             produces="text/plain")
@Timed
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> requestPasswordReset​(@RequestBody
                                                                                      java.lang.String mail)
        POST /account/reset_password/init : Send an email to reset the password of the user.
        Parameters:
        mail - the mail of the user
        Returns:
        the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) if the email was sent, or status 400 (Bad Request) if the email address is not registered

      • finishPasswordReset

        @PostMapping(path="/account/reset_password/finish",
             produces="text/plain")
@Timed
public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<java.lang.String> finishPasswordReset​(@RequestBody
                                                                                     KeyAndPasswordVM keyAndPassword)
        POST /account/reset_password/finish : Finish to reset the password of the user.
        Parameters:
        keyAndPassword - the generated key and the new password
        Returns:
        the ResponseEntity with status 200 (OK) if the password has been reset, or status 400 (Bad Request) or 500 (Internal Server Error) if the password could not be reset
